Overload.descr: Initialization code here. Allows variables to be initialized and functions to be called automatically when a script is first loaded. Note that as of GP 4.5, most variables can be initialized during declaration GP4 allows multiple initialization sections Initialization var... End
On activate Called whenever a rackspace is activated End

Called whenever a Note On message is received Warning: if you define this callback but you do not define a matching NoteOff event, NoteOff events will not be passed on by the receiving MIDI In block because of the way note tracking is managed.
var Arturia : MidiInDevice On NoteOnEvent(m : NoteMessage) matching D#6 from Arturia .... End

Called whenever a Note Off message is received
var Arturia : MidiInDevice On NoteOffEvent(m : NoteMessage) matching D#6 from Arturia .... End

Called whenever a Note On or Note Off message is received Warning: this callback will not be invoked for NoteOn events or for NoteOff events if you have defined NoteOnEvent or NoteOffEvent respectively callbacks
var Arturia : MidiInDevice On NoteEvent(m : NoteMessage) matching D#6 from Arturia .... End

Called when a CC message is received at some MidiIn device
var Arturia : MidiInDevice On ControlChangeEvent(m : ControlChangeMessage) from Arturia .... End
The CC numbers must be within the specified range On ControlChangeEvent(m : ControlChangeMessage) Matching [7..10] from Arturia .... End

Called when a pitchbend message is received at some MidiIn device
var Arturia : MidiInDevice On PitchBendEvent(m : PitchBendMessage) from Arturia .... End

Called when an aftertouch (channel pressure) message is received at some MidiIn device
var Arturia : MidiInDevice On AfterTouchEvent(m : AfterTouchMessage) from Arturia .... End

Displays the string in the log window Declaration: function Print (s : String) Autotype Category: System Parameters
Autotype
Initialization Print("Hello") End
